result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Net Proceeds in an SEO** Orion AutoTech executed a seasoned equity offering (SEO) of 8 million shares at $41.61 per share. Of these, 3 million were primary (new shares issued by the company) and 5 million were secondary (sold by existing investors). Assume the underwriter charges 4.5% of the gross proceeds as an underwriting fee which is shared proportionately between the primary and secondary shares. ::: {.question-block}
1. The amount of money raised by the company (in million USD) is:
✅ Net to issuer = (Primary Shares × Price) − Underwriter fee on primary = (3 × $41.61) − (4.5% × $124.83 million) = $124.83 million − $5.62 million = **$119.2 million**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
2. The amount of money raised by the VC (in million USD) is:
✅ Net to VCs = (Secondary Shares × Price) − Underwriter fee on secondary = (5 × $41.61) − (4.5% × $208.05 million) = $208.05 million − $9.36 million = **$198.7 million**.
::: ::: {.question-block}
3. The amount of money the underwriter will earn (in million USD) is:
✅ Fee = (Total Shares × Price) × Fee Rate = (8 × $41.61) × 4.5% = $332.88 million × 4.5% = **$15 million**.
::: :::
